wiki.content: "Chameleon" is a jazz standard with a characteristic bass line and set to a funky beat. It was composed by Herbie Hancock in collaboration with Bennie Maupin, Paul Jackson and Harvey Mason who also performed the original 15′44″ version on the 1973 landmark album Head Hunters featuring solos by Hancock and Maupin. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Chameleon" is a jazz standard with a characteristic bass line and set to a funky beat. It was composed by Herbie Hancock in collaboration with Bennie Maupin, Paul Jackson and Harvey Mason who also performed the original 15′44″ version on the 1973 landmark album Head Hunters featuring solos by Hancock and Maupin.

track.name: Chameleon
comments: used to bump this in middle school jazz band
cyrone LOVES mucho Herbie.  Pass it around
when I first saw herbie on german tv performing this tune i didn´t even know something like this EXISTED. that must have been 1976/77, since then I´m into this kinda music...makes my day

Overwrought guitar and drum solos in "classic rock" can go fuck themselves. You listen for what, atmosphere? There's nothing down that road. You'd rather listen to something more cerebral. All this shit pays off in a big way. 

This could have been released yesterday and beat the fuck out of Bruno Mars. Oh wait, he wouldn't exist if it wasn't for this. His parents fucking conceived him listening to Herbie.
15 Minutes is juuust right. It hits every note right and adds up to more of the sum of it's parts. You've never seen a group of more cerebrally funky negroes.
this is the funkiest song ever [2]
this is the funkiest song ever
this is the longest two minutes fifty one seconds that I have ever experienced. Last.fm I suspect are not good with numbers...
ad infinitum for a spatial intergalactic galaxy to galaxy wall of sound
I remember the first time I heard this song. I was in high school and it changed my opinion on what music should be forever.
Saw Herbie do this live last year when a non-stop standing ovation brought him back onto the stage.  He truly Rocked. The. House.

When I first heard the full version of this track, I was blown away.  It's the ultimate. @Iran_Ed - no it's not!  @SeveralPeople - This is not a flame, but I think you may want 3 minute pop tracks.  A masterpiece doesn't fit in that time frame.
